meanings.def: happening or existing before something else or before a particular time
examples: Although not essential, some prior knowledge of statistics is desirable.
This information must not be disclosed without prior written consent.
Please give us prior notice if you need an evening meal.
She will be unable to attend because of a prior engagement.

meanings.def: already existing and therefore more important
examples: They have a prior claim to the property.
during the week prior to the meeting

meanings.def: a person who is in charge of a group of monks or nuns living in a priory
(in an abbey) a person next in rank below an abbot or abbess
